error.signature: INFO: pip is looking at multiple versions of X to determine which version is compatible (backtracking)
error.regex: backtracking|pip is looking at multiple versions|Collecting.*very slow

verdict.summary: pip dependency resolver backtracking through many versions. Can take minutes to hours.

dead_ends.why_fails: Skips dependency resolution — may install incompatible versions

workarounds.action: Pin more versions in requirements.txt to reduce the search space
workarounds.how:
# Pin specific versions to reduce resolver search space:
# requirements.txt:
numpy==1.26.4
pandas==2.2.0
scikit-learn==1.4.0

# Generate pinned file from loose requirements:
pip-compile requirements.in --resolver=backtracking

workarounds.action: Use pip-compile (pip-tools) to pre-resolve and lock versions
Upgrade pip — newer versions have faster resolver: pip install --upgrade pip

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'INFO' is a resolution_warning error while 'ERROR' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
